data.event: But East Bank Mayor Chuck Blair said Monday that he expects the major thoroughfare to be shut down at least two days.
"There's a deep mine up there that has been accumulating water for years and years and years," Petry said.
Kathy Cosco, spokeswoman for the state Department of Environmental Protection, said the mine last operated in the 1940s or 1950s.
Melanie Vickers, assistant superintendent in charge of middle schools, said East Bank Middle School will be open today.
Principal Candy Strader drove to the school Monday and saw no damage inside the building, according to Vickers.
But East Bank Mayor Chuck Blair said Monday that he expects the major thoroughfare to be shut down at least two days.

event.title: abandoned mine that had been dormantor for years

data.event: Kanawha County Emergency Services Director Dale Petry said an old, abandoned mine that had been dormantor for years started overflowing early Monday, sending hundreds of thousands of gallons of water cascading across W.Va.
"There's a deep mine up there that has been accumulating water for years and years and years," Petry said.
Kathy Cosco, spokeswoman for the state Department of Environmental Protection, said the mine last operated in the 1940s or 1950s.
Melanie Vickers, assistant superintendent in charge of middle schools, said East Bank Middle School will be open today.
Principal Candy Strader drove to the school Monday and saw no damage inside the building, according to Vickers.

event.title: reopened narrow First Avenue Monday afternoon

data.event: Emergency officials reopened narrow First Avenue Monday afternoon to allow residents access to their homes, but the single-lane street will be open only to passenger vehicles.
"We're kind of on pins and needles now to see what happens next with it," Blair said Monday afternoon.
